bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 99 (Thursday, June 14, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. KING of New York:H.R. 6114.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, clause 1The Congress shall have power to lay and collect Taxes,Duties, Imposts and Excises to pay the Debts and provide forthe common Defence and general Welfare of the United States[[Page H5201]][Page H5200]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.fullName: Del. Radewagen, Aumua Amata Coleman [R-AS-At Large]

item.text:
Metastatic Breast Cancer Access to Care Act

This bill specifies that individuals with metastatic breast cancer are not subject to certain waiting periods for disability insurance benefits under the Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance program and related Medicare coverage.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Metastatic Breast Cancer Access to Care Act

item.title: To amend title II of the Social Security Act to eliminate the waiting periods for disability insurance benefits and Medicare coverage for individuals with metastatic breast cancer, and for other purposes.
Metastatic Breast Cancer Access to Care Act
Metastatic Breast Cancer Access to Care Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
